block.p: EATON VANCE CORP., Boston, which creates, markets and manages mutual funds, said it would split its stock two for one on Nov. 13 to shareholders of record on Oct. 31 and raise its dividend 26 percent this quarter.

STARBAND COMMUNICATIONS INC., McLean, Va., which provides high-speed Internet access, filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission to sell up to $287.5 million of common stock in an initial public offering.

EATON VANCE CORP., Boston, which creates, markets and manages mutual funds, said it would split its stock two for one on Nov. 13 to shareholders of record on Oct. 31 and raise its dividend 26 percent this quarter.

STARBAND COMMUNICATIONS INC., McLean, Va., which provides high-speed Internet access, filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission to sell up to $287.5 million of common stock in an initial public offering.

DRYPERS CORP., Houston, a maker of disposable diapers, filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection after years of struggling to maintain a foothold in the industry. Drypers said it owed millions to a competitor, the Procter & Gamble Company, Cincinnati, for the right to use patents.
TALBOTS INC., Hingham, Mass., a retailer of women's apparel, announced a 2-for-1 stock split, on Nov. 7 to shareholders of record on Oct. 25.
